title: Chicken Stir-Fry with Broccoli and Bell Peppers (Diabetes-Friendly, Quick)
description: a fast and flavorful with lean chicken and plenty of vegetable
instructions: in a small bowl toss chicken with cornstarch and 1 tsp soy sauce
heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over heat
add chicken and until cooked through
add broccoli and bell pepper and for minute until
stir in ginger and garlic and cook for 30 second until fragrant
in a small bowl whisk together remaining soy sauce and water add to the skillet and cook until sauce thickens slightly
serve hot

title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: a refreshing and filling salad with quinoa vegetable and a dressing
instructions: in a large bowl combine cooked quinoa cucumber cherry tomato red onion and olive
in a small bowl whisk together olive oil lemon juice oregano salt and pepper
pour dressing over the quinoa and vegetable and toss gently
stir in feta cheese parsley and mint
serve chilled or at room temperature

title: Baked Cod with Lemon and Herbs (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: a simple and flaky baked cod dish seasoned with fresh herb and lemon
instructions: preheat oven to
place cod fillet on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with rosemary thyme and pepper
arrange lemon slice on top of the cod
bake for minute or until cod is cooked through and flake easily with a fork
serve immediately

title: Spinach and Ricotta Stuffed Shells (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: large pasta shell filled with a creamy spinach and ricotta mixture
ingredients: frozen spinach 1 cup thawed and squeezed dry
instructions: preheat oven to
cook pasta shell according to package direction until al dente
in a bowl combine ricotta cheese spinach egg nutmeg and parsley
fill each pasta shell with the ricotta mixture
spread a thin layer of tomato sauce in the bottom of a baking dish
arrange the stuffed shell in the dish
cover with remaining tomato sauce and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese
bake for minute or until cheese is melted and bubbly

title: Shrimp and Avocado Salad (General, Quick)
description: a refreshing and salad with shrimp and creamy avocado
instructions: in a bowl combine cooked shrimp avocado cucumber and red onion
in a small bowl whisk together lime juice olive oil cilantro salt and pepper
pour dressing over the shrimp and avocado mixture and toss gently
serve immediately

title: Mushroom and Spinach Frittata (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a quick and easy egg dish with savory mushroom and spinach
instructions: heat olive oil in an skillet over medium heat
onion and mushroom until softened
add spinach and cook until wilted
in a bowl whisk together egg milk parmesan cheese salt and pepper
pour egg mixture over the vegetable in the skillet
cook on the stovetop for minute until the edge are set
transfer skillet to a preheated oven at and bake for minute or until the frittata is set in the center
serve warm

title: Lemon Herb Chicken and Veggies (General, Quick)
description: a fast and flavorful meal with chicken and a medley of herb and vegetable
instructions: preheat oven to
toss potato and carrot with 1 tbsp olive oil salt pepper and garlic powder on a baking sheet
arrange chicken thigh and green bean on the same baking sheet
drizzle chicken and green bean with remaining olive oil and lemon juice
sprinkle rosemary and thyme over all
bake for minute or until chicken is cooked through and vegetable are tender
serve hot

title: Black Bean Burgers on Whole Wheat Buns (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: hearty and satisfying homemade black bean burger served on whole wheat bun with your favorite topping
ingredients: black bean 1 can rinsed and drained
instructions: mash the black bean in a bowl with a fork
add oat onion bell pepper garlic cumin and chili powder mix well
form the mixture into two patty
heat a little oil in a skillet over medium heat
cook patty for minute per side or until heated through and slightly browned
serve on whole wheat bun with lettuce tomato onion and optional avocado

title: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Salmon with Zucchini and Cherry Tomatoes (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: a quick and easy sheet pan dinner featuring flavorful salmon and fresh vegetable
instructions: preheat oven to
place salmon fillet zucchini and cherry tomato on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh dill and pepper
arrange lemon slice among the vegetable and on top of the salmon
bake for minute or until salmon is cooked through and flake easily and vegetable are tender
serve immediately

title: Creamy Tomato Soup with Whole Wheat Croutons (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: a comforting and creamy tomato soup served with crunchy whole wheat crouton
ingredients: canned crushed tomato 28 oz low sodium
instructions: heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat
onion until softened then add garlic and cook for 1 minute
stir in crushed tomato vegetable broth and basil bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minute
while soup simmer toss bread cube with a little olive oil and dried herb bake at until crispy
blend the soup until smooth optional stir in heavy cream
serve hot with whole wheat crouton

title: Tofu Scramble with Bell Peppers and Onions (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a quick and savory alternative to scrambled egg
instructions: heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
bell pepper and onion until softened
add crumbled tofu nutritional yeast turmeric salt and pepper
cook stirring occasionally for minute until heated through
serve warm

title: Cucumber and Avocado Rolls (General, Vegetarian, Sushi-Like)
description: refreshing and light roll with cucumber and creamy avocado a sushi option
ingredients: soy sauce low sodium for serving optional
instructions: lay a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat
spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori leaving a small border at the far edge
arrange strip of cucumber and avocado across the rice
using the mat roll the nori tightly
moisten the far edge of the nori with water to seal the roll
slice the roll into piece
sprinkle with sesame seed if desired serve with soy sauce if liked

title: Spicy Peanut Noodles with Stir-Fried Vegetables (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a quick and flavorful noodle dish with a spicy peanut sauce and a variety of vegetable
instructions: cook spaghetti according to package direction
while pasta cook whisk together peanut butter soy sauce rice vinegar honey sriracha garlic and ginger in a small bowl
heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over heat
broccoli and carrot for minute until slightly tender
add red bell pepper and for another 2 minute
add cooked spaghetti and peanut sauce to the skillet toss well to coat
garnish with chopped peanut and serve immediately

title: Baked Chicken Fajita Bowls (General, Quick)
description: easy and flavorful baked chicken fajita bowl with bell pepper and onion
instructions: preheat oven to
toss chicken bell pepper and onion with olive oil and fajita seasoning on a baking sheet
spread in a single layer and bake for minute or until chicken is cooked through and vegetable are tender
serve in bowl over shredded lettuce topped with salsa avocado and a squeeze of lime

title: Broccoli and Cheddar Soup (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: a comforting and creamy broccoli and cheddar soup that can be made with ingredient
ingredients: cheddar cheese cup shredded low sodium
instructions: heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat
onion until softened then add garlic and cook for 1 minute
add broccoli and vegetable broth bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer until broccoli is very tender about 15 minute
carefully blend the soup until smooth
return to the pot and stir in milk and cheddar cheese until melted and creamy
season with black pepper serve hot

title: Tuna and White Bean Salad (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: a simple and salad with tuna white bean and fresh herb
ingredients: canned tuna in water 1 can drained low sodium
white bean cup rinsed and drained low sodium
instructions: in a bowl flake the drained tuna
add white bean celery and red onion
in a small bowl whisk together olive oil lemon juice parsley and pepper
pour dressing over the tuna and bean mixture and stir gently to combine
serve immediately on lettuce leaf or with cracker

title: Avocado and Black Bean Salsa with Whole Wheat Tortilla Chips (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a quick and healthy salsa with avocado black bean and lime served with whole wheat chip
ingredients: black bean cup rinsed and drained
whole wheat tortilla chip small portion
instructions: in a bowl gently combine avocado black bean tomato and red onion
stir in lime juice and cilantro
add if desired for a bit of spice
serve immediately with a small portion of whole wheat tortilla chip

title: Tofu and Vegetable Skewers with Peanut Sauce (General, Vegetarian)
description: grilled or baked tofu and vegetable skewer served with a flavorful peanut sauce
instructions: preheat grill or oven to
thread tofu and vegetable onto skewer
whisk together peanut butter soy sauce rice vinegar honey and water to make the sauce
brush skewer with sesame oil
grill or bake for minute turning occasionally until tofu is lightly browned and vegetable are tender
serve skewer with peanut sauce on the side

title: Spaghetti with Marinara and White Beans (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a simple and satisfying pasta dish with a rich tomato sauce and white bean
ingredients: canned crushed tomato 1 can low sodium
white bean cup rinsed and drained low sodium
instructions: cook spaghetti according to package direction
while pasta cook heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat
garlic until fragrant
stir in crushed tomato white bean oregano salt and pepper
simmer for minute stirring occasionally
drain spaghetti and add it to the sauce toss to coat
garnish with fresh basil and serve

title: Lemon Dill Chicken Salad Lettuce Wraps (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: a light and refreshing chicken salad with a bright lemon and dill flavor served in lettuce wrap
ingredients: cooked chicken breast 150g shredded low sodium
lettuce leaf romaine or butter lettuce
instructions: in a bowl combine shredded chicken celery and red onion
in a separate small bowl whisk together greek yogurt lemon juice dill and pepper
add the dressing to the chicken mixture and stir until well combined
spoon the chicken salad into lettuce leaf
serve immediately

title: Sheet Pan Roasted Vegetables with Chickpeas (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a quick and easy sheet pan meal featuring a variety of roasted vegetable and chickpea
instructions: preheat oven to
toss all vegetable and chickpea with olive oil cumin coriander turmeric salt and pepper on a large baking sheet
spread in a single layer
roast for minute or until vegetable are tender and slightly browned
serve hot

title: Baked Tofu with Sesame Ginger Glaze (General, Vegetarian)
description: flavorful baked tofu with a sweet and savory sesame ginger glaze
instructions: preheat oven to
in a bowl whisk together soy sauce rice vinegar honey sesame oil ginger garlic and cornstarch
place tofu cube in a baking dish and pour the glaze over them ensuring they are well coated
bake for minute flipping halfway through until tofu is golden brown and the glaze ha thickened
garnish with sesame seed and serve hot

title: Quick Tomato Basil White Bean Salad (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a simple and refreshing salad with tomato basil and white bean
ingredients: canned cannellini bean 1 cup rinsed and drained low sodium
instructions: in a bowl gently combine cannellini bean cherry tomato red onion and fresh basil
in a small bowl whisk together olive oil and red wine vinegar
pour dressing over the bean and vegetable mixture and toss gently
season with black pepper serve immediately

title: Salmon Sushi Bowls (General)
description: deconstructed sushi bowl with fresh salmon avocado and your favorite topping
instructions: divide cooked sushi rice into bowl
top with cubed salmon diced avocado and sliced cucumber
sprinkle with shredded nori and sesame seed
serve with soy sauce and pickled ginger on the side

title: Chicken Lettuce Wraps with Peanut Sauce (General, Quick)
description: a light and flavorful dish with seasoned ground chicken served in crisp lettuce cup with a creamy peanut sauce
ingredients: lettuce leaf romaine or butter lettuce
instructions: heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat
add ground chicken and cook until browned
stir in water chestnut and carrot and cook for minute
add soy sauce and rice vinegar and cook until liquid is absorbed
in a small bowl whisk together peanut butter honey and sriracha add a little water if needed to thin
spoon chicken mixture into lettuce leaf drizzle with peanut sauce and sprinkle with green onion

title: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto and Cherry Tomatoes (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a light and refreshing pasta alternative with vibrant pesto and sweet cherry tomato
instructions: spiralize the zucchini into noodle zoodles
gently toss the zucchini noodle with pesto in a bowl
stir in halved cherry tomato
sprinkle with toasted pine nut and optional parmesan cheese
serve immediately

title: Baked Salmon with Roasted Red Peppers and Olives (Low-Sodium)
description: flaky baked salmon with the sweet and savory flavor of roasted red pepper and olive
ingredients: roasted red pepper 1 cup sliced low sodium
kalamata olive cup halved low sodium
instructions: preheat oven to
place salmon fillet on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
arrange roasted red pepper and olive around the salmon
drizzle everything with olive oil and sprinkle with minced garlic oregano and pepper
bake for minute or until salmon is cooked through and flake easily
serve with lemon wedge

title: Creamy Mushroom Soup (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: a rich and comforting creamy mushroom soup made with consideration
instructions: heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat
onion until softened then add mushroom and cook until browned and softened
stir in garlic and thyme and cook for 1 minute
add vegetable broth and bring to a simmer cook for 15 minute
carefully blend the soup until smooth
return to the pot and stir in heavy cream and black pepper heat through gently
garnish with fresh chive before serving

title: Spicy Tuna Rolls (General, Sushi)
description: classic spicy tuna sushi roll with a kick
ingredients: canned tuna in water 1 can drained
soy sauce low sodium for serving
instructions: in a bowl flake the drained tuna and mix with mayonnaise and sriracha
lay a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat
spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori leaving a small border at the far edge
arrange a line of spicy tuna mixture avocado slice and cucumber slice across the rice
using the mat roll the nori tightly
moisten the far edge of the nori with water to seal the roll
slice the roll into piece
serve with soy sauce wasabi and pickled ginger if desired

title: Caprese Pasta Salad (General, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a quick and refreshing pasta salad with the simple flavor of tomato mozzarella and basil
ingredients: fresh basil leaf cup roughly chopped
instructions: in a large bowl combine the cooled pasta halved cherry tomato and mozzarella ball
add the chopped fresh basil
drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze
season with salt and pepper to taste
toss gently to combine
serve immediately or chilled

title: Sheet Pan Sausage and Peppers (General, Quick)
description: a quick and easy meal with flavorful sausage and colorful bell pepper and onion
instructions: preheat oven to
toss sausage slice bell pepper and onion with olive oil oregano garlic powder salt and pepper on a large baking sheet
spread in a single layer
roast for minute or until sausage is cooked through and vegetable are tender and slightly browned
serve hot optionally with a side of whole wheat bread

title: Greek Chickpea Salad (Diabetes-Friendly, Vegetarian, Quick)
description: a refreshing and salad with chickpea mediterranean vegetable and a tangy dressing
instructions: in a bowl combine chickpea cucumber tomato red onion and olive
in a small bowl whisk together olive oil red wine vinegar oregano dill salt and pepper
pour dressing over the chickpea and vegetable mixture and toss gently
stir in crumbled feta cheese
serve chilled or at room temperature

title: Baked Lemon Herb White Fish (Low-Sodium, Quick)
description: a simple and healthy baked white fish seasoned with bright lemon and fresh herb
ingredients: white fish fillet tilapia cod 2 x 150g
instructions: preheat oven to
place white fish fillet on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh parsley and pepper
arrange lemon slice on top of the fish
bake for minute or until fish is cooked through and flake easily
serve immediately

title: Vegetable Curry with Coconut Milk (Kidney-Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: a flavorful and aromatic vegetable curry made with coconut milk and vegetable
instructions: heat coconut oil in a pot over medium heat
onion until softened then add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute
stir in bell pepper and cauliflower and cook for 5 minute
add green bean coconut milk and curry powder bring to a simmer and cook for minute until vegetable are tender
garnish with fresh cilantro before serving optionally with a small portion of whole wheat pasta

title: Smoked Salmon and Avocado Sushi Rolls (General, Sushi)
description: delicious sushi roll filled with rich smoked salmon and creamy avocado
ingredients: soy sauce low sodium for serving
instructions: lay a nori sheet on a bamboo rolling mat
spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori leaving a small border at the far edge
arrange slice of smoked salmon avocado and optional cream cheese across the rice
using the mat roll the nori tightly
moisten the far edge of the nori with water to seal the roll
slice the roll into piece
serve with soy sauce wasabi and pickled ginger if desired

title: Pasta with Roasted Vegetables and Pesto (General, Vegetarian)
description: a flavorful pasta dish featuring roasted seasonal vegetable tossed with vibrant pesto
ingredients: assorted vegetable zucchini bell pepper eggplant cherry tomato 2 cup chopped
instructions: preheat oven to
toss chopped vegetable with olive oil minced garlic salt and pepper on a baking sheet
roast for minute or until vegetable are tender and slightly browned
cook pasta according to package direction
drain pasta and add it to a large bowl
toss with roasted vegetable and pesto sprinkle with optional parmesan cheese
serve warm

title: Baked Chicken Breast with Roasted Root Vegetables (Heart Failure Friendly)
description: a simple and healthy meal featuring lean chicken and naturally flavorful roasted root vegetable
instructions: preheat oven to
toss carrot sweet potato and parsnip with olive oil thyme rosemary and pepper on a baking sheet
arrange chicken breast among the vegetable
bake for minute or until chicken is cooked through and vegetable are tender
garnish with fresh parsley before serving

title: Lentil and Vegetable Stew (Heart Failure Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: a hearty and nutritious stew packed with vegetable and protein from lentil seasoned with mild herb
ingredients: fresh spinach 1 cup wilted in at the end
instructions: heat olive oil in a pot over medium heat
onion celery and carrot until softened
stir in lentil diced tomato vegetable broth bay leaf and marjoram
bring to a boil then reduce heat and simmer for minute or until lentil are tender
remove bay leaf stir in spinach until wilted serve warm

title: Baked White Fish with Dill and Lemon (Heart Failure Friendly, Quick)
description: a quick and light baked white fish seasoned with fresh dill and a touch of lemon
ingredients: white fish fillet cod tilapia 2 x 150g
instructions: preheat oven to
place white fish fillet on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fresh dill and pepper
place lemon slice on top of the fish
bake for minute or until fish is cooked through and flake easily
serve immediately

title: Turkey and Vegetable Meatloaf (Heart Failure Friendly)
description: a leaner take on traditional meatloaf using ground turkey and incorporating finely chopped vegetable
ingredients: whole wheat breadcrumb cup low sodium
instructions: preheat oven to
in a large bowl combine ground turkey onion carrot celery breadcrumb egg parsley and pepper
gently mix until just combined avoid overmixing
shape the mixture into a small loaf and place it in a baking dish
spread tomato paste over the top
bake for minute or until cooked through
let it rest for a few minute before slicing and serving

title: Berry Smoothie (Heart Failure Friendly, Quick)
description: a refreshing and smoothie made with ingredient and limited added sugar
ingredients: mixed berry 1 cup fresh or frozen
plain greek yogurt cup low fat
instructions: combine all ingredient in a blender
blend until smooth and creamy
add a little more almond milk if needed to reach desired consistency
serve immediately

title: Tofu and Vegetable Skewers (Heart Failure Friendly, Vegetarian)
description: grilled or baked tofu and colorful vegetable marinated in seasoning
instructions: preheat grill or oven to
in a bowl gently toss tofu and vegetable with olive oil lemon juice oregano garlic powder and pepper
thread tofu and vegetable onto skewer
grill or bake for minute turning occasionally until vegetable are tender and tofu is lightly browned
serve hot
